â
'''Clam AntiVirus''' ('''ClamAV'''), is an [[antivirus software]] toolkit for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] and [[Unix-like]] operating systems. One of its main uses is with [[mail exchange server]]s as a server-side [[email virus]] scanner.
+
'''Clam AntiVirus''' ('''ClamAV'''), is a [[free software|free]] [[antivirus software]] toolkit for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] and [[Unix-like]] operating systems. One of its main uses is with [[mail exchange server]]s as a server-side [[email virus]] scanner.
â
Distributed under the terms of the [[GNU General Public License]] (GPL), ClamAV is [[free software]]. Both ClamAV and its updates are made available free of charge.
+
Both ClamAV and its updates are made available free of charge.
[[Sourcefire]], a maker of [[intrusion detection]] products and the owner of [[Snort (software)|Snort]], announced on [[2007-08-17]] that it had acquired the [[trademarks]] and [[copyrights]] to ClamAV from five key developers.<ref>{{ cite web | url=http://www.clamav.org/2007/08/17/sourcefire-acquires-clamav/ | title=Sourcefire acquires ClamAV | publisher=ClamAV | date=2007-09-17 | accessdate=2008-02-12 }}</ref>
[[Sourcefire]], a maker of [[intrusion detection]] products and the owner of [[Snort (software)|Snort]], announced on [[2007-08-17]] that it had acquired the [[trademarks]] and [[copyrights]] to ClamAV from five key developers.<ref>{{ cite web | url=http://www.clamav.org/2007/08/17/sourcefire-acquires-clamav/ | title=Sourcefire acquires ClamAV | publisher=ClamAV | date=2007-09-17 | accessdate=2008-02-12 }}</ref>
